childnodes.sy: Fried eggs and tater tots go great with bourbon at Radiator Whiskey. Come on a Wednesday for the Beast Feast — just be sure to order it in advance.

You can get breakfast for dinner or dinner for breakfast at Mecca Café, making it the perfect hangover cure spot. Go all out and order the Deck Hand: three poached eggs, crispy hash browns, sausage, bacon and flapjacks. Need a little hair of the dog?

Calozzi’s serves up real deal cheesesteaks in Seattle. Try the original with onions and Cheez Whiz. Take it to go and wash it down with a beer at Two Beers Brewing. Just be sure you eat it while it’s still hot for the optimum Philly cheesesteak.

Enjoy a bit of Hawaii in Seattle at Kona Kitchen. All-day breakfast items like the eggs Benedict are pretty mind-blowing, as are traditional Hawaiian stars like the loco moco. Plenty of parking, ample seating and friendly service add to Kona Kitchen’
You really can’t lose with $2.99 burgers and fries and dollar beers at happy hour at Lost Lake Café & Lounge, especially when it all tastes so good.

Traditional Latin cuisine with a global twist awaits at Isla del Mojito. Enjoy live music and brunch on the weekends, and be sure to order the biscuits and gravy, and creamy polenta. Free parking is an added bonus.
If you’ve got a big appetite, the veggie burrito at Gorditos has you covered. Top it with the killer chipotle salsa and you’re good to go for the rest of the night.
